content:
• Friday, August 14, 2015
  • VUZI

    Vuzix closes down 6.6% following Q2 report; product sales drop

    • Vuzix (NASDAQ:VUZI) fell to $4.11 today after reporting its product sales fell to $428K in Q2 from $696K in Q1 and $610K a year ago. Net loss of $2.4M compared with a loss of $5.1M in Q1 and income of $239K a year ago.
    • Nonetheless, the smartglass maker insists its sales mix is much improved from a year ago, when a majority of the sales for its M100 headset "were non-recurring and made to early adopters and developers." It argues current sales are being driven by customers placing bigger orders, and predicts "the majority of these will be recurring in nature as these customers expand their pilots to actual live-use programs." The remarks come as Google gets set to do a commercial launch for an enterprise-focused Google Glass model.
    • Financials: Product gross margin was 8.3%, down from 31.7% a year ago. GAAP operating expenses rose 84% Y/Y to $2.2M - $732K was spent on R&D, $345K on sales/marketing, and $1M on G&A. Vuzix ended Q2 with $20M in cash/short-term investments.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 6:55 PM | 5 Comments
  • KKR

    Report: Samson Resources to file for bankruptcy by mid-September

    • KKR -6.1% AH after Dow Jones reports Samson Resources plans to file for chapter 11 bankruptcy by mid-September after finalizing a restructuring plan with key creditors today.
    • The move would wipe out the ~$4.1B investment of KKR and its partners, which led a $7.2B leveraged buyout of Samson in 2011 in the biggest-ever such deal for an oil and gas producer.
    • Samson, which is primarily a natural gas producer, has lost more than $4.5B since the buyout, including a $490M loss during Q1, the most recent period for which it has reported results.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:20 PM | 14 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: BBEP +9.7%. SSE +6.8%. SGMO +6.7%. SGYP +3.4%. MYGN +2.7%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: INFI -3.9%. JWN -3.9%. BLDR -3.7%. EPD -3.2%. RS -3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM | 20 Comments
  • MU

    Micron closes down 4.2% after hosting analyst day; Einhorn ups stake

    • Micron (NASDAQ:MU) used today's analyst day to set an FY16 (ends Aug. '16) capex budget of $5.3B-$5.8B, up from an FY15 budget of $3.6B-$4B. The company insisted its "normalized" capex budget is around $4.1B, after backing out "strategic partner investments" of $0.7B-$0.9B and a $0.6B-$0.8B shell investment in a NAND flash fab (fab 10X). Other areas of investment include 20nm DRAM, 3D NAND, and 3D XPoint.
    • The company forecasts a 20%-30% DRAM bit shipment CAGR from FY15 to FY17, and a 30%-40% NAND bit shipment CAGR. DRAM bits/wafer are expected to rise 65%-75% from the end of FY15 to the end of FY17, and NAND bits/wafer 140%-150%.
    • Following major DRAM price declines triggered by soft PC demand, CEO Mark Durcan reiterated his stance that the memory industry has structurally changed thanks to consolidation. CFO Ernie Maddock stated Micron has bought back $500M worth of shares thus far in FQ4, and cut its dilutive shares by ~12% in FY15 through the end of FQ3.
    • MKM's Ian Ing (Neutral) thinks management's tone regarding the near-term outlook remained cautious, and argues strategic partner investments "could remain a recurring part of capex given the pipeline of unannounced partnership deals and new memory technologies."
    • Separately, David Einhorn's Greenlight Capital has disclosed it owned 37.9M Micron shares at the end of Q2, up from 33.5M at the end of Q1. Einhorn defended Micron last month in his Q2 letter, after taking major losses on his position in June.
    • Analyst day slides (.pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM | 96 Comments

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: GDXJ +10.7%. GDX +8.13%. FCG +6.86%. AMJ +4.74%. PSLV +4.25%.
    • Losers: OIL -4.84%. VNM -4.13%. USO -3.91%. EWS -3.89%. ILF -3.05%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 5 Comments
  • IDN

    Intellicheck sees 13.2% drop following Q2 report

    • Intellicheck (NYSEMKT:IDN) fell to $1.25 today after reporting its revenue rose 91% Y/Y to $2.29M, its net loss rose 10% to $1.21M, and its booked orders rose 28% to $2.91M.
    • Weighing on earnings: Gross margin fell to 45.4% from 62.6% a year ago. GAAP operating expenses rose 22% Y/Y to $2.26M - G&A spend totaled $1.27M, R&D $680K, and sales $308K.
    • Intellicheck ended Q2 with $7.9M in cash, down from $9.7M at the end of Q1. The company's market cap is now at $12.3M.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • CBK

    Sharp sell-off in Christopher & Banks

    • Christopher & Banks (CBK -47.5%) plunges after the company issues lower guidance and initiates an operational review.
    • The company also hired outside consultants to help it analyze results and strategy after same-store sales fell 12% in FQ2
    • Shares of C&B are down 70% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 2 Comments
  • ANDV

    Tesoro downgraded at Howard Weil as margin complacency sets in

    • Tesoro (TSO -1.9%) is lower as shares are downgraded to Sector Perform from Sector Outperform at Scotia Howard Weil, although the price target is raised by $3 to $114, as the firm says it is becoming concerned that investors are growing complacent with a West Coast margin environment well above mid-cycle levels.
    • TSO had climbed more than 6% heading into today's trading after strong Q2 earnings and indications that Q3 could be even better; since the results, analyst estimates for Q3 free cash have increased to $4.57/share from $2.77.
    • Weil says its general stance on refiners remains constructive into fall turnarounds, with the view that differentials could improve on top of a persistently strong underlying margin environment, but it does not believe TSO will continue to outperform peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • SFXE

    SFX Entertainment confirms go-private deal off, sets Oct. 2 deadline

    • SFX Entertainment (SFXE -24%) has confirmed with an update this afternoon that its deal to be taken private by CEO Robert Sillerman at $5.25/share is "no longer effective."
    • The company will now entertain bids for itself "in whole or in part" until Oct. 2 -- which might include Sillerman coming back in with an offer at a lower price, now that the share price (currently $1.48) has dropped so far below the deal price agreed on in May.
    • It's received one indication of interest at a price lower than $5.25/share, the company says. Listening to offers until Oct. 2 will give potential buyers a look at performance during peak festival season.
    • SFX had previously said it might consider selling assets (such as streaming service Beatport?) separate from a wholesale deal for the company.
    • "Robert F. X. Sillerman has a problem with credibility and SFX Entertainment has a problem with not making money," says SA contributor Chris DeMuth Jr. "The value prospects overall are dubious. Sillerman will probably continue to talk about a deal long after anyone believes him. None of that is likely to change by the new go-shop deadline of Oct. 2."
    • Previously: SFX Entertainment -24% as CEO's private financing deadline passes (Aug. 14 2015)
    • Previously: SFX Entertainment up 13.6% as Albert Fried upgrades to Overweight, $5 target (Aug. 11 2015)
    • Previously: SFX Entertainment, -13.7%, hints at asset sale prospect (Jul. 27 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 7 Comments
  • INVE

    Identiv up 16% after Q2 report; customer win growth reported

    • Identiv (NASDAQ:INVE) has jumped above $4 after posting Q2 sales that were in-line with the outlook provided in the company's Aug. 4 warning. Guidance for full-year revenue of $65M-$70M (also provided in the warning) has been reiterated.
    • Possibly going over well: In spite of the Q2 shortfall, the provider of RFID and smart card authentication systems says it "experienced an increase in large customer wins including a major international airline, multiple government agencies and large technology companies." At the same time, deployment delays hurt revenue recognition.
    • Gross margin rose to 43% from Q1's 41% and Q2 2014's 40%. Operating expenses rose 25% Y/Y to $12.9M. Identiv ended Q2 with $30.8M in cash, and $5.9M worth of payment obligations.
    • New products related to the Cisco deal are on track to launch in Q3. Shares remain down 7% from where they traded prior to the warning.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 5 Comments
  • TSN

    Tyson Foods to eliminate 400 jobs

    • Tyson Foods (TSN +0.6%) plans to cut 400 jobs to adjust for a decrease in beef production.
    • The company also says it will close a plant in Iowa.
    • Cattle herds in the U.S. are still feeling the impact from droughts in previous summers.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 3 Comments
  • LL

    Lumber Liquidators +3% after Tiger Management discloses position

    • Lumber Liquidators (NYSE:LL) is up 2.6% after sitting in negative territory for much of the day.
    • There was a volume spike on the stock after Tiger Management disclosed a position of 238K shares.
    • SEC Form 13F
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 11 Comments
  • ADGE

    American DG Energy says CFO Parmese dies

    • American DG Energy (ADGE -9.5%) discloses the sudden death of CFO Gabriel Parmese; shares are halted.
    • ADGE says it has not yet appointed anyone to assume Parmese's responsibilities.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • KMPH

    KemPharm's lead product candidate performs well in human abuse liability study; NDA on track for Q4; shares up 29%

    • Thinly traded relatively recent IPO KemPharm (KMPH +29.1%) heads north on an 11x surge in volume in response to its announcement of positive results from an intranasal human abuse liability study of its lead product candidate, KP201/APAP, in development for the treatment of acute moderate-to-severe pain. Based on these results, plus the data from three tamper resistance studies expected this quarter, the company intends to file its New Drug Application (NDA) with the FDA in Q4.
    • The intranasal trial compared the amount of hydrocodone released from the active ingredient, when snorted, without acetaminophen to hydrocodone bitartrate (HB). KP201 showed a statistically significant lowering in peak hydrocodone exposure, a delay in the time to peak exposure and a significant decrease in total exposure to hydrocodone, especially in the early time points associated with increased drug liking and abuse. KP201 was also more difficult to snort than HB.
    • KP201/APAP is a combination of the prodrug of hydrocodone, KP201, and acetaminophen (APAP). It is an abuse deterrent design, based on a molecular structure that prevents the release of the opioid when crushed or physically manipulated. The company believes that this is a more effective approach to abuse deterrence than formulation-based methods.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMCC

    AppliedMicro's CFO leaving; shares -5.2%

    • Douglas Ahrens, AppliedMicro's (NASDAQ:AMCC) CFO since Oct. 2013, is leaving to become the CFO of a private software company, effective Aug. 21.
    • Karen Rogge, whose resume includes stints as Extreme Networks' CFO and Seagate's finance VP, will serve as interim CFO while AppliedMicro looks for a permanent replacement. The company is reiterating its FQ2 guidance.
    • FBR's Chris Rolland (Market Perform rating) calls Ahrens' departure "a meaningful negative" for the telecom IC/ARM server CPU vendor. "Mr. Ahrens played a key role in instituting and enforcing the cost-cutting program that was essential to conserving the company’s cash balance of just $77 million ... While Karen Rogge appears to be a stop-gap candidate, it will be challenging to find an equivalent and permanent CFO willing and capable to make the tough decisions needed to see this company successfully through [its] transition."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • NSRGY

    Handicapping a Mondelez acquisition

    • Nestle (OTCPK:NSRGY, OTCPK:NSRGF) or General Mills (GIS +0.5%) could make a run at Mondelez International (MDLZ +0.9%) with Berkshire Hathaway and 3G effectively taking themselves out of the bidding process for a few years due to the Kraft-Heinz merger, speculates The Deal.
    • A buyer of Mondelez will have to be heavy hitter due to the company's estimated enterprise value of +$90B. PepsiCo (PEP +0.3%) fits the bill and has Nelson Peltz backing the play, but has a board and CEO seemingly uninterested.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 26 Comments
  • AMAT

    AMAT now down 3.7% post-earnings; ASML down 2.7%

    • After barely budging at first in response to its FQ3 report - it featured a slight revenue miss, in-line EPS, light FQ4 guidance, and healthy order data - Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) has sold off to new 52-week lows today. Lithography equipment giant ASML is also off.
    • Possibly weighing: On its earnings call (transcript), AMAT forecast 2015 wafer fab equipment (WFE) sales would be flat Y/Y (below a prior forecast for 3% growth), with potential downside risk. Lower-than-expected foundry capex is ,ostly blamed; memory capex remains strong, and (in spite of Intel's recent $1B capex budget cut) Applied's logic outlook is unchanged.
    • Several firms have cut their targets. Pac Crest's Weston Twigg (Outperform, target cut by $4 to $23): "We are concerned that foundry demand is softening due to end-market weakness, which could last several quarters. Worse, if 16/14 nm ramps slow down, and 10 nm capacity is limited to smaller pilot lines next year, foundry capex could decline in 2016. We also expect Intel's capex to remain low next year as it maximizes equipment reuse amid low PC demand."
    • Semiconductor Advisors' Robert Maire thinks company-specific issues are also weighing. "AMAT is better off than KLAC which is a purer play linked to the weak foundry/logic space but weaker than LRCX which has a better memory and multipatterning exposure. This dynamic is not likely to change in the near term given Applied's product mix including its process diagnostics group. Though AMAT may claim otherwise, we are not sure that AMAT is gaining significant share versus Lam overall."
    • Jefferies' Sundeep Bajikar (Buy, target cut by $3 to $25) is still a believer. "Strong order growth and optimism about share gains in 3D NAND reinforces our secular thesis, and is likely to be a positive surprise for investors. While we believe our foundry competition thesis is also playing out, we misjudged timing of foundry orders. However, following CapEx cuts from TSMC and Intel we think foundry weakness was baked into the stock, which has declined 32% YTD (vs. SOX -8%) in spite of solid fundamentals. AMAT remains one of our top picks.”
    • AMAT's FQ3 results, guidance/orders
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • SYY

    Trian takes stake in Sysco

    • Trian Fund Management officially files notice of its 7% stake in Sysco (SYY +8.4%). The largest blocks of shares were purchased in August, although the accumulation has progressed steadily since June.
    • The filing indicates Trian expects to have an active role with Sysco.
    • "The Trian Group intends to have further discussions with members of the Board of Directors."
    • "The Reporting Persons may take other steps or make other recommendations intended to enhance shareholder value."
    • SEC Form 13D
    • Previously: Sysco pops after report of Trian position
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: PBMD +46%. SOCB +41%. ONTX +33%. FORD +26%. GV +26%. KMPH +19%. CRK +18%. CHLN +17%. EFOI +18%. BLPH +16%.
    • Losers: XGTI -58%. CBK -50%. AAVL -27%. IPDN -24%. SFXE -24%. LOCO -19%. ERS -19%. RELV -16%. BIOS -16%. CAPN -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • SYY

    Sysco pops after report of Trian position

    • Sysco (SYY +6.4%) is higher after CNBC tips Trian Partners has taken a stake.
    • The hedge fund's position is reported to be 7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • YELP

    Yelp up 3.4% after fund manager's CNBC plug

    • Apex Capital's Gil Simon, making a contrarian bull case for YELP on CNBC: "We've seen this before. A lot of Internet companies have struggled as they've grown ... Facebook is a great example ... Netflix obviously had similar issues. And really, these companies have had crises of confidence on Wall Street, which have lasted for periods of time." (video)
    • Apex notes only 4% of businesses on Yelp are currently paying the company, and argues (like Facebook/Netflix a few years ago) its growth story remains in its early stages. The defense of the local reviews leader comes two weeks after its shares plunged due to a Q2 EPS miss and soft guidance.
    • Previously: Citron calls Yelp's selloff "a bit overdone"
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 7 Comments
  • SFXE

    SFX Entertainment -24% as CEO's private financing deadline passes

    • A little over day after a deadline to show financing in taking SFX Entertainment (NASDAQ:SFXE) private, both CEO Robert Sillerman and the company are silent, and shares are down 24.2% and at all-time lows.
    • Sillerman had until 10 a.m. yesterday to show financing for 100% of the cash commitment in his $5.25/share offer; shares have now dropped to $1.47, giving it a market cap of just over $142M.
    • The stock has lost 78.4% of its value over the past year, and Sillerman and the company agreed on the $5.25/share price on May 26. But the end of a go-shop period had the company speculating about selling off parts, and extending Sillerman's deadline to prove financing an extra few days, to yesterday.
    • Previously: SFX Entertainment up 13.6% as Albert Fried upgrades to Overweight, $5 target (Aug. 11 2015)
    • Previously: SFX Entertainment up 1.3% as Q2 revenues grow 31% (Aug. 10 2015)
    • Previously: SFX Entertainment -1%, sets deadline for go-private financing (Jul. 30 2015)
    • Previously: SFX Entertainment, -13.7%, hints at asset sale prospect (Jul. 27 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 5 Comments
  • IMMP

    Prima BioMed to receive clinical milestone from Novartis; shares up 43%

    • Nano cap Prima BioMed (PBMD +42.5%) jumps on a 9x surge in volume in response to its announcement that it will receive an disclosed clinical milestone payment from Novartis (NVS) related to the Phase 1 study of its IMP701 LAG-3 antibody for the treatment of cancer.
    • The license and collaboration agreement was signed in September 2012 between Immutep (acquired by Prima in December 2014) and CoStim Pharmaceuticals (acquired by Novartis in February 2014).
    • Prima is eligible to receive additional development-related milestones and royalties on commercial sales.
    • IMP701 binds to LAG-3 (Lymphocyte Activation Gene 3), an antibody that plays a key role in controlling the signaling pathways in both effector T cells and regulatory T cells. Binding to LAG-3 removes two brakes that prevent the immune system from responding to and killing cancer cells.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • PCTY

    Paylocity down 5.9% after FQ4 beat, mixed guidance

    • While Paylocity (NASDAQ:PCTY) beat FQ4 estimates, it's guiding for FQ1 EPS of -$0.07 to -$0.09 (below a -$0.03 consensus), and FY16 (ends June '16) EPS of -$0.04 to -$0.08 (below a $0.02 consensus).
    • Revenue guidance is stronger: FQ1 revenue of $41M-$42M (above a $40.3M consensus), and FY16 revenue of $199M-$203M (above a $191.5M consensus and good for 32% Y/Y growth at the midpoint).
    • Heavy spending is set to pressure EPS: CEO Steve Beauchamp stated on the earnings call (transcript) Paylocity plans to grow its quota-carrying sales reps by 30% in FY16 to 164, and also plans to continue investing heavily in R&D. Operating expenses (non-GAAP) rose 41% Y/Y in FQ4 to $25.4M.
    • The customer base for Paylocity's cloud HCM/talent management software rose 22% in FY15 to 10,350. Average recurring revenue per client grew 16% to $13,900.
    • FQ4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • QIWI

    Qiwi up 4.4% after discussing counterparty fraud probe

    • QIWI states it has cooperated with authorities on investigations related to a limited number of counterparties, and insists such requests are a normal part of business.
    • A Qiwi representative: "We closely cooperate with [authorities] in matters that relate to uncovering fraud, illegal trading and other unlawful activities. This most recent occasion required us to provide certain additional information concerning our users, clients, partners and employees. While law enforcement officers were on site, the company and our payment services continued to operate normally."
    • Shares have rallied on a day the Nasdaq is down 0.3%, and Russian markets are up modestly. Q2 results are expected later this month.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • CF

    CF Industries upgraded at Barclays following aggressive moves

    • CF Industries (CF +2.7%) is upgraded to Overweight from Neutral with a $71 price target, raised from $64, at Barclays, which cites the company's two most recent major transactions as "proactive and positive."
    • CF's substantial off-take agreement and $2.8B equity buy-in with the CHS co-op indicate that management has "no intention of resting on past laurels," Barclays says, encouraged that CF "clearly doesn't intend to simply play defense going into the next cycle."
    • The firm says the deals highlight that CF recognizes the need to "combine a low-cost position with the distribution breadth and market influence needed to protect that position."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 2 Comments
  • AZPN

    Aspen down 12.3% on soft FY16 revenue guidance

    • Though Aspen Technology (NASDAQ:AZPN) beat FQ4 estimates, the company guided on its earnings call (transcript) for FY16 (ends June '16) revenue of $465M-$473M, down from a prior $470M-$478M and below a $474.9M consensus. EPS guidance of $1.56-$1.62 is improved from a prior $1.51-$1.57, and favorable to a $1.56 consensus. Lifting the EPS outlook: GAAP expense guidance has been cut by $3M to $272M-$277M.
    • FQ1 guidance is for revenue of $118M-$120M and EPS of $0.40-$0.42, above a consensus of $115.1M and $0.38. The guidance includes $5M of revenue "that is not being recognized on a purely ratable basis," and thus won't roll forward to subsequent quarters.
    • CEO Antonio Pietri noted oil price declines have affected the sales and capex budgets of engineering & construction (E&C) industry clients, and thus hurt their spending on Aspen's process-optimization software. This trend was particularly strong in North America, and isn't expected to change in the near-term.
    • Subscription/software revenue rose 15% Y/Y in FQ4 to $105.6M; services/other revenue fell 15% to $8.5M. Operating expenses rose a moderate 7% Y/Y to $54.7M, and $73.6M was spent to buy back 1.8M shares.
    • FQ4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • KMI

    Kinder Morgan wins spot on Goldman's Conviction Buy List

    • Kinder Morgan (KMI +3%) is added to the Conviction Buy List with a $48 price target at Goldman Sachs, which sees KMI as a safe haven in an uncertain macro environment due to its diverse portfolio of assets with a high percentage of fee-based, take-or-pay contracts.
    • Goldman believes KMI is well positioned to achieve its targeted annual dividend growth rate of 10% through 2020, driven by an organic project backlog worth $22B focused on highly contracted infrastructure.
    • The firm sees upside from M&A, and believes KMI trades at too wide a discount relative to history and its peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 41 Comments
  • ADTM

    Adaptive Medias drops 21.3% as Q2 loss widens

    • OTC-traded Adaptive Medias (OTCPK:ADTM) is off 21.3% after posting Q2 revenues that were flat sequentially and an EBITDA loss that declined from Q1, but a net loss that widened from the prior year.
    • Net loss came to $3.63M vs. a year-ago loss of $1.92M; EPS dropped to -$0.23 from -$0.32 after heavier dilution.
    • Revenues were steady at $1.1M (down 1.4% Y/Y) despite a seasonally softer quarter. EBITDA was -$1.8M after R&D expenses and sales and marketing expenses declined slightly.
    • It appointed John Strong, its recently named interim CEO, to its board.
    • Conference call to come at 1 p.m. today.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • XGTI

    xG Technology down 54.8% after pricing stock/warrant offering

    • xG Technology (NASDAQ:XGTI) is selling 2.55M Class A stock/warrant units at $1.00, and 2.45M Class B units at $0.99. For reference, shares closed yesterday at $2.21.
    • The Class A units consist one share and half of a Series A warrant to buy a share at $1.00, and come with 2.55M Series C warrants featuring a $1.00 exercise price. The Class B units consist of a pre-funded Series B warrant to buy a share and half of a Series A warrant, and come with 4.95M Series D warrants featuring a $0.99 exercise price.
    • Gross proceeds are expected to total $5M. xG ended Q1 with just $821K in cash.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • DTEA

    DAVIDsTEA drifts lower again

    • DAVIDsTEA (NASDAQ:DTEA) is down 1.1% in early trading to hit a post-IPO low of $12.50.
    • Some buyers of the stock are now down over 50% if they purchased during the first week of the IPO, and even investors given the first grab of shares at the underwriting price are below water.
    • Long-term bulls on DAVIDsTEA think the potential of the chain growing to 400 to 500 stores makes the growing pains tolerable.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • BPI

    Bridgepoint Education discloses CFPB probe

    • Bridgepoint Education (BPI -4.4%) discloses it received a request for information from the CFPB.
    • The probe centers on deceptive marketing practices of private student loans.
    • SEC Form 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • KING

    King Digital drops 10.9% as analysts cut targets after Q2 report

    • King Digital (BATS:KING), fresh off an earnings report where it noted user declines for its online games and weak Q3 guidance, has sunk 10.9% out of the open as analysts cut price targets in response.
    • JPMorgan Chase downgraded the stock to Hold and set a $17 price target. Meanwhile, Wedbush lowered its target to $18 (from $21), and RBC Capital cut its target to $15, from $17. Shares closed yesterday at $15.20 and are trading currently at $13.53.
    • Wedbush's Michael Pachter reiterated an Outperform rating, noting beats on EPS and bookings and that King trades at an EV/EBITDA multiple of about 4.5x.
    • But it's "unclear" when the company expects a return to growth: Declines in Candy Crush bookings were meant to be offset by growth in all other games, which wasn't the case.
    • "We believe that the timing of new game launches and the choice of genres are the primary culprits responsible for the revenue decline," he wrote. "Investors are clearly impatient with the lack of growth, and we don’t blame them. The pace of new games has slowed in 2015, and visibility into the company’s lineup for 2016 and beyond is murky at best."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 2 Comments
  • IDXG

    PDI up 35% premarket on test coverage by large insurer

    • PDI (PDII) is up 35% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement that one of the largest Blue Cross Blue Shield plans will cover the ThyGenX Thyroid Oncogene Panel and ThyraMIR Thyroid miRNA Classifier from subsidiary Interpace Diagnostics. This particular Blue Cross, insuring 3.3M lives, is the first commercial plan to cover ThyraMIR.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • CYBR

    CyberArk up 3.3% on post-earnings Wells Fargo upgrade

    • Wells Fargo has upgraded CyberArk (NASDAQ:CYBR) to Outperform three days after the company posted a Q2 beat and issued strong Q3 guidance, and set a $70-$73 valuation range. CyberArk has risen to $59.98 premarket.
    • A slew of other firms have also released bullish post-earnings notes this week. Dougherty's Catharine Trebnick (target hiked to $72): "[CyberArk's] quarterly performance was attributed to continued growth in licensing revenue, expansion of product purchases across current customers and increased demand for Privileged Access Management (PAM) products following the Office of Personnel Management and Anthem breaches. We continue to be bullish on their products and early market positioning in the PAM segment. As one of the fastest growing security companies and one of the few profitable emerging players in the sector, we believe their hyper-growth justifies the high valuation multiples that have concerned certain investors."
    • Oppenheimer's Shaul Eyal ($70 target): "At the highest range of CYBR's elevated FY15 guidance, revenue should grow 32% YoY and we attribute this strong performance and outlook to: 1) Security spending acceleration; 2) customers' attraction to CYBR's suite rather than point solution approach; 3) CYBR's ability to upsell into its growing customer base as well as benefit from greenfield opportunities."
    • Update: Wells Fargo's upgrade follows industry checks and a meeting with CFO Joshua Siegel. "With recent breach headlines, we think enterprises are increasingly looking to expand privileged account management solutions."

  • DWDP

    DuPont upgraded at J.P. Morgan after five years of lagging the market

    • DuPont (DD) +1.8% premarket after J.P. Morgan upgrades shares to Overweight from Neutral with a $60 price target, up from $58, citing a positive risk/reward profile after five years of underperforming the market despite lingering negative conditions in the chemicals industry.
    • "High-quality agricultural companies have received high-teens EBITDA bids, which we read as a rough marker of intrinsic value," JPM says, adding that DuPont's plans to repurchase shares worth $4B over the next 18 months may offer "stability or strength to the share price."
    • The firm says the referendum on DuPont's performance sought by activist investor Nelson Peltz that was settled by a vote of confidence in management is a positive for the stock, and "management is now in a position to demonstrate that the confidence of its shareholder base was well-placed."

    J.C. Penney higher after comps and margins improve in Q2

    • J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) reports same-store sales rose 4.1%% in Q2. The mark is high enough to indicate the department store chain took market share from some rivals.
    • The company's gross margin rate was +100 bps Y/Y to 37.0%.

    • Operating income rate +120 bps to -1.30%.

  • ONTX

    Onconova submits IND for IV rigosertib for second line treatment of HR-MDS; shares up 76% premarket

    • Onconova Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ONTX) submits an Investigational New Drug (IND) application to the FDA for its lead product candidate IV rigosertib for the treatment of higher-risk myelodysplastic syndromes (HR-MDS) after failure of hypomethylating agent therapy. Once approved, the company will be cleared to initiate a pivotal Phase 3 study for the indication. Patient enrollment is expected to commence later this year.
    • The late-stage trial, designated 04-30 or INSPIRE, will enroll ~225 HR-MDS patients under the age of 80 who have progressed on or failed to respond to previous treatment with HMAs within the first nine months of initiation of treatment. The primary endpoint will be overall survival.
    • Rigosertib is a small molecule the inhibits cellular signaling in cancer cells by acting as a Ras mimetic. Ras proteins are involved in transmitting signals within cells.
    • Shares are up 76% premarket on increased volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM

  • ADVM

    Avalanche Bio's lead product candidate not quite there in mid-stage study; back to the lab for further refinement; shares off 14% premarket

    • Based on additional analyses of the data from a Phase 2a clinical trial in wet age-related macular degeneration, Avalanche Biotechnologies (AAVL) decides not to proceed to Phase 2b with its lead product candidate AVA-101. Instead, it will conduct further preclinical studies to clarify the optimal dose and delivery of AVA-101 and AVA-201 compared to standard-of-care anti-VEGF protein therapy before advancing the best candidate back into the clinic. The process should be completed by the end of the year.
    • The company's decision shouldn't be a surprise. The stock plummeted 40% in June after the company reported less-than-expected results from the Phase 2a study.
    • The value proposition of AVA-101, a gene therapy that contains a gene that encodes a naturally occurring anti-VEGF protein, is a single subretinal injection compared intravitreal (inside the eye) injections as frequent as once per month for Regeneron's (NASDAQ:REGN) Eylea and Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY) Lucentis.
    • Shares are down 14% premarket on light volume.
    • Previously: Avalanche Bio plummets 40% after hours on less-than-expected AVA-101 data; chances dim for pick up by Regeneron (June 15)
